author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of Treasury yields of yonder land,
Odin's eye on charts doth stand.
Further falls the dragon's tail,
Whispers UOB's foretelling tale.

In golden hoards to Carmot goes,
Roche, the giant, its might shows.
Their purse swells by billions two,
And near half a billion in view.

Odin watches as Spotify bleeds,
Feasting ravens on job loss seeds.
Third round this year, words they cast,
In pursuit of golden gain amassed.

feedItems.title: U.S. 10-Year Treasury Yield May Fall Further, Charts Show
feedItems.description: The U.S. 10-year Treasury yield may fall further, based on technical charts, UOB’s Global Economics & Markets Research said.

feedItems.title: Roche to Buy Carmot Therapeutics for $2.7 Billion
feedItems.description: Roche said it would buy the California-based obesity and diabetes drugs maker for $2.7 billion with additional payments of up to $400 million based on development milestones.

feedItems.title: Spotify to Lay Off 17% of Staff, Its Third Round of Job Cuts This Year
feedItems.description: The streaming giant will cut about 1,500 more jobs as it accelerates a profitability push.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In realms of study, choices laid so bare,
Private halls glow, with public gold they flare,
By their own will, the pupils claim their share,
In scholarly banquet, their fate ensnared.

Behold! In Red Sea's deep and brangled sway,
A choice destroyer, caught in tumultuous fray,
With drone and missile, the quietus lay,
'Gainst commerce's steeds, the threat held at bay.

A beauty Queen, a crown of universe adorned,
In Nicaragua's tale, now bitterly scorned,
Accused and charged, in power's scorn,  
E'er after the bloom of victory was worn.

feedItems.title: Under voucher plans  that pay for private schooling with public funds, students who have already opted out of public schools are among the biggest beneficiaries, state data indicate.
feedItems.description: Under voucher plans that pay for private schooling with public funds, students who have already opted out of public schools are among the biggest beneficiaries, state data indicate.

feedItems.title: A U.S. destroyer and three commercial ships in the Red Sea came under drone and missile attacks, a significant escalation of recent strikes on vessels in those waters.
feedItems.description: A U.S. destroyer and three commercial ships in the Red Sea came under drone and missile attacks, a significant escalation of recent strikes on vessels in those waters.

feedItems.title: Nicaragua charged a Miss Universe franchise owner with being part of a plot to overthrow Ortega two weeks after the country won the pageant.
feedItems.description: Nicaragua charged a Miss Universe franchise owner with being part of a plot to overthrow Ortega two weeks after the country won the pageant.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Talks of peace, stalled on Gaza's mend,
A goat and dog in struggle's end.
Dire orders bade, to narrower land confine,
In strife, the snail leaves no gentle sign.

In Dubai's high court, the world convenes,
To curb the poison from the ravines.
Upon the hare and hound, a promise does rely,
The U.S. curbs the fumes that foul the sky.

The magistrates, a tax law weigh,
On profits gleaned from foreign bay.
Like rabbits chased by dogs, through endless power,
A challenge stands in the Supreme tower.

feedItems.title: Talks between Israel and Hamas to hand over hostages held in Gaza in return for a truce stalled, while Israeli forces escalated attacks and directed Palestinians in the enclave to move to a narrower strip of land.
feedItems.description: Talks between Israel and Hamas to hand over hostages held in Gaza in return for a truce stalled, while Israeli forces escalated attacks and directed Palestinians in the enclave to move to a narrower strip of land.

feedItems.title: Global leaders at the COP28 climate summit in Dubai are taking a big swing at cutting methane, while the U.S. set rules on domestic fuel producers to limit emissions of the gas.
feedItems.description: Global leaders at the COP28 climate summit in Dubai are taking a big swing at cutting methane, while the U.S. set rules on domestic fuel producers to limit emissions of the gas.

feedItems.title: A lawsuit to be heard by the Supreme Court takes aim at a 2017 law imposing a tax on companies' overseas profits, and could have wider implications over Congress's taxing power.
feedItems.description: A lawsuit to be heard by the Supreme Court takes aim at a 2017 law imposing a tax on companies’ overseas profits, and could have wider implications over Congress’s taxing power.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of German trade surplus, quoth this humble brother,
Goods in low export, yet surplus spills over.
Just as robust wine eases worldly bother,
In the cask of commerce, prosperity we discover.

Ere comes the dawn, a toast to the green new venture,
Carry clean power o'er vast lands in miniature.
Like a barrel full of ale on a holy adventure,
To the city's thirst, 'tis a saintly suture.

Take heed, good sirs, the fickle dance of gold,
Its uptrend holds, yet a pullback may unfold,
Like spirits in a chalice, bold yet behold,
Before long, we may see its value remold.

feedItems.title: Germany Books Wider Trade Surplus as Exports Fall Again
feedItems.description: The eurozone’s most important economy booked a bigger-than forecast-trade surplus of almost €18 billion, as exports of German goods fell for a fourth straight month.

feedItems.title: The New Green Investment: Getting Clean Energy to Big Cities
feedItems.description: EnergyRe, a startup backed by real-estate executives, raises $1.2 billion for transmission lines to carry renewable electricity to urban areas.

feedItems.title: Gold's Uptrend Intact, But Minor Pullback Likely, Charts Show
feedItems.description: Gold’s medium-term uptrend is intact, but a minor pullback is possible, based on technical analysis, Oanda said.
